data.title: Do append selection with SHIFT key instead of CTRL
data.body: Title says it already. I am not sure if the implementation with CTRL is intended, but the original game uses SHIFT so I fixed it that way.

data.title: Try to use georgia font in-game
data.body:
Georgia seems to be used at least for resource counts.
For an authentic look, it should be used in the UI.

http://fontsgeek.com/fonts/Georgia-Bold

Could also be http://fontsgeek.com/fonts/Copperplate-Gothic-Bold-Regular

follow up to #355

data.title: Add references to our subreddit /r/openage as user forum
data.body:
We won't host a user forum, instead use a subreddit.

https://www.reddit.com/r/openage/

We should integrate this into our documentation/readme, maybe the game itself (not sure if that should be done now)

Just to make users are aware that this is the place to talk and share their ideas.

data.title: Warn players when disconnecting from loosing game
data.body:
It's very annoying that players leave the game, especially in early phases, because they think they have lost.

We should add a warning that says something like:

```
Hey you, have you tried fleeing to one of your allies?
Try moving to their base and support their fight!
It's bad habit leaving the other players hanging, so please reconsider.
```

And probably adapt the message by analyzing the game state.
Other ideas? :)

data.title: Added support for importing string data from HD 2.0
data.body:
Added support for HD Edition 2.0, where string data is in DLLs in PATH/Data/LANG/*.dll

This might be better done by detecting that version explicitly, rather than checking for DLLs in the languages folder, but this works for now.

Prior to this fix, the importer would try to read the .dlls as text files, resulting in the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run.py", line 15, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/__main__.py", line 94, in main
    return args.entrypoint(args, cli.error)
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/game/main.py", line 33, in main
    if not convert_assets(assets, args):
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/convert/main.py", line 125, in convert_assets
    for current_item in convert(args):
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/convert/driver.py", line 126, in convert
    yield from convert_metadata(args)
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/convert/driver.py", line 179, in convert_metadata
    stringres = get_string_resources(args)
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/convert/driver.py", line 69, in get_string_resources
    stringres.fill_from(read_hd_language_file(langfile, lang, enc='iso-8859-1'))
  File "/home/archie/openage/openage/convert/hdlanguagefile.py", line 25, in read_hd_language_file
    num, string = line.split(None, 1)
ValueError: not enough values to unpack (expected 2, got 1)
```

data.title: Missing dependency - readline
data.body:
While attempting to build i got the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/local/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 170, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/opt/local/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/Users/robindegen/Development/Projects/openage/openage/__main__.py", line 102, in <module>
    exit(main())
  File "/Users/robindegen/Development/Projects/openage/openage/__main__.py", line 65, in main
    from .convert.main import init_subparser
  File "/Users/robindegen/Development/Projects/openage/openage/convert/main.py", line 6, in <module>
    import readline  # pylint: disable=unused-import
ImportError: No module named 'readline'
```

I used easy_install to install readline, after that the problem was gone. The building.md file makes no mention of this dependency. I think it should be added.

I'm using OSX 10.11.2 with python 3.5.

data.title: libopenage/unit/type_pair.h - what is it?
data.body: It confuses the code navigation a bit.

data.title: Add Age2:HD steamcmd installation guide
data.body:
The Linux steam won't download Age2:HD, but there's a trick:

Downloading raw depots when you launch steam with `-console` option.

Check https://steamdb.info/app/221380/depots/ for depot information.

```
$ steam -console
steam> download_depot <app_id> <depot_id> # app_id = 221380
```

There are multiple depots for a game possible, steam usually packages languages into depots, you need to download all the depots you need.

To download the main content, you would use:

```
steam> download_depot 221380 221381
```

See guide @janisozaur wrote for another project: https://github.com/OpenRCT2/OpenRCT2/wiki/Installation-on-Linux#native

Please add the guide to our docs! :dancers:

data.title: Switch to #pragma once (#459)
data.body:
Hi guys!

I just discovered this project and was really excited seeing people work on an open source "linux port" of Age of Empires 2.

Then I thought why not help these guys out a bit with simple tasks?!

And so here I am with my first PR, targeting and hopefully closing issue #459.

Let me know what you think =)

data.title: Create cvar configuration subsystem
data.body:
In the style of [Half-Life 2 cvars](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/List_of_HL2_Cvars), we should implement a configuration system that uses simple key-value assigning.

Once a key is defined, the values has to be of a type: `str`, `int`, `float`, ...
When parsing a config file, the type conversion is attempted and errors can be detected.

This configuration is then used by the engine to control all sorts of things.
Ideally, the definition of known cvars should be in Python or Cython, with an interface to the C++ code (just follow the [python interface docs](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/master/doc/code/pyinterface.md) for that).

As this code is not performance-critical, it should be in Python, which simplifies modding later.

A settings that could be implemented as a proof-of-concept is e.g. the initial window resolution.
Then, it lays the foundation for #271.

data.title: Cross-platform separation
data.body:
Currently, we try to use the `libopenage/crossplattform` folder for switches.
But this is kinda bad, ugly and hard to maintain.

New proposal:

Do everything within the subsystem, e.g. util/, job/, ... whatever.
The things currently in crossplattform/ should be migrated there.

Within a subsystem, the switches should be as clean and few as possible, e.g. one implementation for linux, win32, etc. Basically this equals the stubbing for windows we began.

That way, the code can stay in its subsystem and, if well coded, is better to understand as the subsystem locality is maintained and code jumps are minimized.

Thoughts?

data.title: Cythonize determine_rgba_matrix() (see #431)
data.body:
This improves total conversion time (`--no-sound`) from 4:36 to 3:11.

Benchmarks for `convert-file Age2HD/Data/graphics.drs 61.slp /tmp/test`:

|  | Old | New |
| --- | --- | --- |
| SLP parsing/drawing | 0.038 |  |
| determine_rgba_matrix() | 0.136 | 0.053 |
| Texture packing | 0.002 |  |
| PNG encoding/writing | 0.031 |  |

data.title: Optimize PNG encoding speed for asset conversion
data.body:
TODO https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/72cca2d9960cbd35c227f78880ade0ed0aa5ad8e/openage/convert/texture.py#L100 suggests switching to libpng (from PIL) to speed up PNG encoding and writing.

---

Here's a benchmark comparing the options that are **available through PIL**. Note that it may be skewed, because I couldn't be bothered to run tests multiple times in a clean environment. It should still give a general idea.

Tested command: `python3 -m openage convert --force --no-sound`

Processor: `i7-4800MQ @ 2.70GHz Ã— 8`

| Option | Size of `assets/converted/graphics` | Time taken |
| --- | --- | --- |
| compress_level=0 | 773.7 MB | 4:44 |
| compress_level=1 | 129.2 MB | 4:32 |
| compress_level=2 | 125.8 MB | 4:32 |
| compress_level=6 (status quo) | 124.0 MB | 4:36 |
| optimize=True (highest) | 123.6 MB | 4:37 |

Doesn't look like there's much in it.

---

See also #431 for another idea to optimize the speed of asset conversion.

data.title: Missing util/compiler implementation for WIN32
data.body:
The `dlfcn` headers are provided by this package https://github.com/dlfcn-win32/dlfcn-win32 that wraps winapi calls into the posix api.

However, `dlfcn-win32` doesn't provide dladdr (because it is not posix, more info here https://github.com/dlfcn-win32/dlfcn-win32/issues/21) so we should work around it on WIN32.

data.title: Missing StackAnalyzer implementation for WIN32
data.body:
Currently, if the `WITH_BACKTRACE` flag is set by CMake, the modern `backtrace.h` is used. Else, the GNU's `execinfo.h` is tried.

When building on MSYS2, it tries to include `execinfo.h` and fails, because `execinfo` isn't available for windows.

[Here](http://spin.atomicobject.com/2013/01/13/exceptions-stack-traces-c/) is some example code for catching exceptions and getting stack traces on windows platforms.

This should be implemented in `libopenage/error/stackanalyzer.cpp`.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29897119-missing-stackanalyzer-implementation-for-win32?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: [WIP] Trying to fix buildsystem/simple
data.body:
The `DEVMODE = True` was missing on config.py.

Now it compiles, but trying to run openage (`python run.py`) gives the following:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run.py", line 15, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/fd/src/openage/openage/__main__.py", line 94, in main
    return args.entrypoint(args, cli.error)
  File "/home/fd/src/openage/openage/game/main.py", line 23, in main
    from ..cppinterface.setup import setup
  File "/home/fd/src/openage/openage/cppinterface/setup.py", line 11, in <module>
    from ..log.log_cpp import enable_log_translation
ImportError: No module named 'openage.log.log_cpp'
```

Steps to reproduce:
- clone this
- `git clean -fdx`
- `./buildsystem/simple`
- `python run.py`

data.title: buildsystem: actually check if executable was found
data.body: this closes #460

data.title: Reset the amount gathered upon switching resource type
data.body: When switching to different resource type for gathering, reset the amount already gathered. Fixed #364

data.title: Update copying.md
Expanded the critical section to include init()
data.body:
Won't this init() interleave when multiple threads enter the function?
The potential result would be the wrong thread_id paired with the wrong timestamp.
Moving the guard up would mitigate it.
